4.title: How to Not: Fully Commit
4.plot: Your best friend asks you to be her maid of honor, which means dragging you along to a battery of wedding planning activities. The amount of commitment she's making is stressing you out, so you use the girl you're secretly dating as a sexy escape route, only to find the girl's got plans of her own.

5.title: How to Not: Bail on a Date
5.plot: You fight every impulse you have and bring the first girl you've ever tried dating to your best friend's engagement party. As you fumble over how to introduce her, she steals the show. But when your best friend sees through your ruse, you have some explaining to do.

6.title: How to Not: Hate Yourself
6.plot: When you blow a date with the perfect woman and the rejection leaves you hating yourself, you embark on an intimate journey to find some self love (and hopefully win her back).

imdb.plot outline: Your story starts like all modern love stories: all alone, half drunk, on the internet. All your friends seem to have it totally together and you have no idea what you're doing with your life. A last ditch effort to conjure some meaning ends with an unlikely-yet-genuine Tinder connection: a drunk girl named Jamie who says just the right thing.
imdb.title: How to Not
plot: _How to Not_ (qv) is a story about inelegantly chasing that one thing on the road becoming who you are. It starts as so many modern day romances start, all alone at night, half drunk and on the internet.

Your story starts like all modern love stories: all alone, half drunk, on the internet. All your friends seem to have it totally together and you have no idea what you're doing with your life. A last ditch effort to conjure some meaning ends with an unlikely-yet-genuine Tinder connection: a drunk girl named Jamie who says just the right thing.

In your 20s, somewhere between college and true adulthood, is a period of dissatisfaction. Your job isn't what you thought it would be, your relationships aren't turning out the way you envisioned them, and life in general doesn't feel anything like a reality you're comfortable with. You are confused, you are embarrassed, and you have no idea how to communicate any of that to anyone around you. And then, in the middle of all that ugh, you see a small and hopeful light at the end of a very dark tunnel... One thing connects! One thing makes sense, never mind the fact that you can't make sense of why it makes sense. And for the first time in a long time, you have some glimpse at something that might actually make you happy. _How to Not_ (qv) is a story about inelegantly chasing that one thing on the road becoming who you are. It starts as so many modern day romances start, all alone at night, half drunk and on the internet. This is my open love letter to anyone who's feeling like no one gets it, I just want you to know, you're not alone. So if your insomnia has struck again, and you're lurking the depths of the internet at 3am while devouring a sinful "snack" (fistfuls of croutons, maybe dipped in ranch?) and feeling lonely in a way you can't explain, this one is for you.

Sometimes the radical change you are looking for can start with your Tinder settings. _How to Not_ (qv) starts how most modern love stories do, half-drunk, alone and on the internet. Best LBGT short at the Hollywood Reel Independent Festival. Official Selection Web Series at New Media Fest. Award of Merit Web Programming at IndieFEST.
